page.title: 01A BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: The first impression one gets of the area upon entering via the busy A249 link road is of a semi-rural landscape hard by an industrial complex and port facility at Sheerness. Once one penetrates into the area it becomes clear that it provides a good deal of housing and farmland in fairly equal proportions. The Isle of Sheppey takes its name from sheep and one will not need to look far to find evidence of these. There has been a rapid growth in the amount and variety of houses in the area, mainly being small developments and many of which are self built. Also within its bounds are a fine old abbey, golf course, shops, garages, several pubs, a hospital, cricket, soccer and rugby grounds, equestrian centres and several interesting walks offering fine views of the island and beyond.
